metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14834 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in dnsmasq before version 2.81, where the memoryleak allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) via vectors involving DHCP response creation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14834` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.79-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-base - 2.79-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.79-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.79-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.79-1ubuntu0.2').
